channel.title: AI Weekly Newsletter
channel.description: Curated AI trends, tools, and research — updated every Monday.

item.title: A Small-Scale System for Autoregressive Program Synthesis Enabling Controlled Experimentation
item.description: What research can be pursued with small models trained to complete true programs?
item.author: Russ Webb, Jason Ramapuram

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
item.description: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices. To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.
item.author: Remi Grzeczkowicz, Eric Soriano, Ali Janati et al.

item.title: PABU: Progress-Aware Belief Update for Efficient LLM Agents
item.description: Large Language Model (LLM) agents commonly condition actions on full action-observation histories, which introduce task-irrelevant information that easily leads to redundant actions and higher inference cost.
item.author: Haitao Jiang, Lin Ge, Hengrui Cai et al.

item.title: Transformers.js v4 Preview: Now Available on NPM!
item.description: Read more about *Transformers.js v4 Preview: Now Available on NPM!* from Hugging Face Blog.

item.title: Introducing SyGra Studio
item.description: Read more about *Introducing SyGra Studio* from Hugging Face Blog.

item.title: Nemotron ColEmbed V2: Raising the Bar for Multimodal Retrieval with ViDoRe V3’s Top Model
item.description: Read more about *Nemotron ColEmbed V2: Raising the Bar for Multimodal Retrieval with ViDoRe V3’s Top Model* from Hugging Face Blog.

item.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
item.description: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.
item.author: Connie Loizos

item.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
item.description: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.
item.author: Lucas Ropek

item.title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
item.description: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.
item.author: Russell Brandom

item.title: How to Model The Expected Value of Marketing Campaigns
item.description: The approach that takes companies to the next level of data maturity The post How to Model The Expected Value of Marketing Campaigns appeared first on Towards Data Science .
item.author: Rodrigo Almeida

item.title: Implementing the Snake Game in Python
item.description: An easy step-by-step guide to building the snake game from scratch The post Implementing the Snake Game in Python appeared first on Towards Data Science .
item.author: Mahnoor Javed

item.title: How to Personalize Claude Code
item.description: Learn how to get more out of Claude code by giving it access to more information. The post How to Personalize Claude Code appeared first on Towards Data Science .
item.author: Eivind Kjosbakken

item.title: Ask HN: Is it time to fork HN into AI/LLM and "Everything else/other?"
item.description:
I would very much like to enjoy HN the way I did years ago, as a place where I'd discover things that I never otherwise would have come across.

The increasing AI/LLM domination of the site has made it much less appealing to me.

item.title: Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought?
item.description: Read more about *Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought?* from Hacker News (AI).

item.title: Show HN: Countless.dev – A website to compare every AI model: LLMs, TTSs, STTs
item.description: Read more about *Show HN: Countless.dev – A website to compare every AI model: LLMs, TTSs, STTs* from Hacker News (AI).

item.title: tensorflow/tensorflow
item.description: An Open Source Machine Learning Framework for Everyone (193,688 stars, C++).

item.title: Significant-Gravitas/AutoGPT
item.description: AutoGPT is the vision of accessible AI for everyone, to use and to build on. Our mission is to provide the tools, so that you can focus on what matters. (181,780 stars, Python).

item.title: ollama/ollama
item.description: Get up and running with Kimi-K2.5, GLM-4.7, DeepSeek, gpt-oss, Qwen, Gemma and other models.

item.title: CoMMa: Contribution-Aware Medical Multi-Agents From A Game-Theoretic Perspective
item.description: Recent multi-agent frameworks have broadened the ability to tackle oncology decision support tasks that require reasoning over dynamic, heterogeneous patient data.
item.author: Yichen Wu, Yujin Oh, Sangjoon Park et al.

item.title: FlyAOC: Evaluating Agentic Ontology Curation of Drosophila Scientific Knowledge Bases
item.description: Scientific knowledge bases accelerate discovery by curating findings from primary literature into structured, queryable formats for both human researchers and emerging AI systems.
item.author: Xingjian Zhang, Sophia Moylan, Ziyang Xiong et al.

item.title: Overview of PAN 2026: Voight-Kampff Generative AI Detection, Text Watermarking, Multi-Author Writing Style Analysis, Generative Plagiarism Detection, and Reasoning Trajectory Detection
item.description: The goal of the PAN workshop is to advance computational stylometry and text forensics via objective and reproducible evaluation.
item.author: Janek Bevendorff, Maik Frobe, Andre Greiner-Petter et al.

item.title: Measuring Inclusion in Interaction: Inclusion Analytics for Human-AI Collaborative Learning
item.description: Inclusion, equity, and access are widely valued in AI and education, yet are often assessed through coarse sample descriptors or post-hoc self-reports that miss how inclusion is shaped moment by moment in collaborative problem solving (CPS).
item.author: Jaeyoon Choi, Nia Nixon

item.title: Effective Reasoning Chains Reduce Intrinsic Dimensionality
item.description: Chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning and its variants have substantially improved the performance of language models on complex reasoning tasks, yet the precise mechanisms by which different strategies facilitate generalization remain poorly understood.
item.author: Archiki Prasad, Mandar Joshi, Kenton Lee et al.

item.title: Don't Shoot The Breeze: Topic Continuity Model Using Nonlinear Naive Bayes With Attention
item.description: Utilizing Large Language Models (LLM) as chatbots in diverse business scenarios often presents the challenge of maintaining topic continuity. Abrupt shifts in topics can lead to poor user experiences and inefficient utilization of computational resources.
item.author: Shu-Ting Pi, Pradeep Bagavan, Yejia Li et al.

item.title: Beyond Uniform Credit: Causal Credit Assignment for Policy Optimization
item.description: Policy gradient methods for language model reasoning, such as GRPO and DAPO, assign uniform credit to all generated tokens - the filler phrase "Let me think" receives the same gradient update as the critical calculation "23 + 45 = 68." We propose counterfactual importance weighting: mask reasoning spans, measure the drop in answer probability, and upweight tokens accordingly during policy gradient updates.
item.author: Mykola Khandoga, Rui Yuan, Vinay Kumar Sankarapu

item.title: Community Evals: Because we're done trusting black-box leaderboards over the community
item.description: Read more about *Community Evals: Because we're done trusting black-box leaderboards over the community* from Hugging Face Blog.

item.title: H Company's new Holo2 model takes the lead in UI Localization
item.description: Read more about *H Company's new Holo2 model takes the lead in UI Localization* from Hugging Face Blog.

item.title: Amazon may launch a marketplace where media sites can sell their content to AI companies
item.description: A new report claims the e-commerce giant is looking to create a pipeline of licensable content between media publishers and AI companies.
item.author: Lucas Ropek

item.title: An ice dance duo skated to AI music at the Olympics
item.description: Czech ice dancers Katerina Mrazkova and Daniel Mrazek are learning the hard way that LLMs sometimes spit out straight-up plagiarism.
item.author: Amanda Silberling

item.title: A “QuitGPT” campaign is urging people to cancel their ChatGPT subscriptions
item.description: In September, Alfred Stephen, a freelance software developer in Singapore, purchased a ChatGPT Plus subscription, which costs $20 a month and offers more access to advanced models, to speed up his work. But he grew frustrated with the chatbot’s coding abilities and its gushing, meandering replies. Then he came across a post on Reddit about….
item.author: Michelle Kim
